sect1.title: DefaultMessageGenerator
sect1.para: The generator is able to generate a load using multiple threads for long period of time (matter of days, weeks,...). It uses a thread pool of a fixed size that stores threads that execute performance iterations. The thread pool uses an internal queue where tasks implementing the iterations are buffered and scheduled for execution. The size of the thread queue can be specified by threadQueueSize property. The generator periodically checks the thread queue and fills the queue with new tasks. The period in which the generator checks the thread queue (and fills with new tasks) can be specified by the monitoringPeriod property.

This approach guarantees that maximum number of thread instances (that is equal to the value of the threadQueueSize property) exists in the memory during all the time the generator is working. In addition it is even possible to specify the maximum generating rate (iterations per time period) that can be quantified by threadQueueSize / monitoringPeriod .

To configure the generator we need to specify number of concurrent threads (using threads attribute), size of the thread queue (via threadQueueSize property) and a duration (using the run discussed above).

Following table shows the properties of the DefaultMessageGenerator:
DefaultMessageGenerator properties
Property name Description Required Default value
monitoringPeriod The period in milliseconds in which the task queue is filled with new tasks No 1000
threadQueueSize The size on the task queue. No 1000

simplesect.title: Example of DefaultMessageGenerator configuration
simplesect.programlisting: ... <generator class="DefaultMessageGenerator" threads="100"> <run type="time" value="60000"/> <property name="threadQueueSize" value="50000"/> ... </generator> ...
